page.title: 03Population in the Cowtons
page.content: A survey of the population in the area shows a striking contrast between the residents in North & East Cowton. With its new estates, East Cowton attracts young executives who generally have two or three children. Houses change ownership more often than in N Cowton where residents are often from old village families. East Cowton is more densely populated. On average 3.5 people live in a house, whereas the average in North Cowton is 2.1. There is a higher proportion of OAP's in North Cowton, 20% in the survey, as opposed to 7% in East Cowton. Children form 35% of the population in E Cowton whereas in N Cowton they only form 20% South Cowton has a scattered population of approx. 100. Like North Cowton they are mostly old Cowton families and a high proportion of them are involved with farming.
